intro: Cnidoscolus loasoides, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or forest understories.
